result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. Moran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber is granted for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve half on Electronic/Home Monitor if the defendant qualifies by the risk assessment and jail administration.
- STAYED -

miscConds.notes: - AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, Agent can accept a recent prior assessment.

- Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
- No violent or abusive contact with the victims R. M. or M. M.

- Pay costs and surcharges including domestic abuse surcharge.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick J. Moran

records.addlTxt: Length of probation added to JOC
Letter from the DOC dated 05/25/22 in re:  length of probationary term omitted from the JOC
Waiver of Right to an Attorney filed by Pro Se Defendant
Count 1:  Imposed but STAYED Jail with Probation

8:56 AM Defendant Patrick J. Moran in court.  Assistant District Attorney (Atty) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions Defendant on his waiver of counsel.
Court finds the defendant has knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to an attorney and understands the process, benefits of having attorney and that an attorney could investigate and present evidence on his behalf and understands the law better than he does. 
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Parties stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct, domestic with repeater enhancer removed.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victims are not present.
ADA Cassidy's sentencing statements are heard by the Court.
Defendant's statements are heard by the Court.

BY THE COURT: 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence
Serve 60 days in jail. 
2 days credit.
Huber is granted for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve half on Electronic/Home Monitor if the defendant qualifies by the risk assessment and jail administration.
- STAYED - 

Placed on probation for a period of 12 months
Conditions of Probation: 
- AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, Agent can accept a recent prior assessment. 
- Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
- No violent or abusive contact with the victims R. M. or M. M.
- Pay costs and surcharges including domestic abuse surcharge.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 04/19/22 - no such number

ADDRESS INFO for Patrick J. Moran
Current: 6954 4th St, Stevens Point, WI 54482   (Effective: 02-04-2022)
Prior: 6554 4Th St, Stevens Point, WI 54482
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 03/21/22 - no such number
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:29 PM Defendant Patrick J. Moran in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies the defendant's address. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Court makes statements regarding charges. 
Defendant states this should be his 1st offense. 

Court makes additional statements regarding use of the repeater language.
State reviews the complaint and moves to strike the repeater language. 

Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

NO CONTEST plea is entered by the defendant. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the states request to remove the repeater language.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for February 21, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1

No violent or abuive contact with: R.M., M.M. or J.G. Remain absolutely sober from alcohol.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Soule appears in court for defendant. 

1:13 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

ADA  Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of disorderly conduct, domestic. 
Atty Soule states Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: February 21, 2022   @  1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
